intro: Castalia pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's castalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Castalia pringlei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its ornamental value and unique appearance make it a sought-after plant among horticulturists.
